Massachusetts Bay Colony

OCLC # Title Author Language Item type Publication Publisher Database Notes Added date Library
39950794 Riders dictionarie corrected, and augmented with the addition of many hundred words not extant in any former edition : hereunto are annexed Riders calendar, and certaine tables explaining the names, weights, and valuations of auncient and moderne coynes, as also a table of the Hebrew, Greeke & Latine measures, reduced to our English standard & assise : whereunto is joyned a dictionarie etymologicall, deriving each word from his proper fountaine, the first that ever was extant in that kind, with many worthy castigations & additions, as will appeare in he title and epistle before it John Rider; Francis Holyoake English book_mic Oxford : Printed by Iohn Lichfield and William Turner, printers to the famous Vniversity, Ann. Dom. 1627. 2017-05-08 16:01
614736149 Annotations upon the five Bookes of Moses, the Booke of the Psalmes, and the Song of Songs or Canticles. Henry Ainsworth English book_printbook London : Bellamie, 1627 2017-05-08 15:59
84750678 Annotations upon the five bookes of Moses, the booke of the Psalmes, and the Song of Songs, or, Canticles. VVherein the Hebrevv vvords and sentences, are compared with, and explained by the ancient Greeke and Chaldee versions, and other records and monuments of the Hebrewes: but chiefly by conference with the holy Scriptures, Moses his words, lawes and ordinances, the sacrifices, and other legall ceremonies heretofore commanded by God to the Church of Israel, are explained. With an advertisement touching some objections made against the sinceritie of the Hebrew text, and allegation of the Rabbines in these annotations. As also tables directing unto such principall things as are observed in the annotations upon each severall booke. By Henry Ainsworth. Henry Ainsworth English book_printbook London : Printed [by M. Flesher and J. Haviland] for Iohn Bellamie, and are to be sold at his shop in Cornehill, at the signe of the three Golden Lions neere the Royall Exchange, 1627. 2017-05-08 15:58
